title: Hebron
content: An ancient city of Judah, 3040 feet above the Mediterranean, 20 miles south of Jerusalem; known also as Mamre and Kirjath-arba (
). It was the burying place of Abraham and his family (
), and became the property of Caleb (
). It was one of the six cities of refuge (
), and David’s capital during the earlier part of his reign (
). During the later history of the nation it continued to be a place of importance, and it still has a large population.
